newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech bank CSOB raising prime rate to 12.05 pct.
newsitem.headline: Czech bank CSOB raising prime rate to 12.05 pct.

text.p: Czech bank Ceskoslovenksa Obchodni Banka a.s. said on Monday it would raise its prime lending rate by 30 basis points to 12.05 percent, effective May 20.
CSOB said it was also raising three other base rates by the same amount.
As of May 20, one-year credits will start at 12.3 percent, while credits from one to two years will have a base rate of 12.55 percent, and two to three years funds will begin at 12.8 percent.
The statement made no further comment.
The move comes after the central bank raised its Lombard rate on Friday to 50 percent from 14 percent, and allowed its repo rate to be more influenced by market conditions.
On Monday, the maximum rate at repo auctions for one week, overnight funds and tomorrow/next day funds was 45 percent, up from 12.9 percent on Friday.
